Wool less favoured for meat for some: Hill country NZ farmers invest in self-shedding sheep https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/wool-nudies-nudies-hill-country-sheep-sheep-farmers-strip-cost-costs-costs-back-to-the-bone/l2rnyzoe4ff7bhk2qybimoh2ga/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/wool-nudies-nudies-hill-country-sheep-sheep-farmers-strip-cost-costs-costs-back-to-the-bone/l2rnyzoe4ff7bhk2qybimoh2ga/ Farmers are investing in self-shedding sheep to avoid shearing costs. Wed, 29 Jan 2025 02:00:00 +0000 Wiltshire and Nudies breeds don't grow wool which means farmers don't incur costs such as shearing.
Two-metre swells, 30-knot winds, send Napier race boats packing https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/news/two-metre-swells-swells-30-knot-winds-winds-send-send-race-race-boats-packing/ats2rxidwrbbbbvjyazxtjfegfru/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/two-metre-swells-swells-30-knot-winds-winds-send-send-send-race-boats-packing/ats2rxidwrbbbbvjyazxtjfegfru/ Doug LaingLess than half the boats in the Napier racing survived the first two races undamaged. Wed, 29 Jan 2025 01:59:59 +0000 Last two standing - near-vintage offshore racing boats Fury and Midnight Express parked-up on Sunday after the cancellation of the second day's racing in Napier. Fury raced in 1974, and on Saturday won the overall honours for the 60-mile classes. Photo / Doug Laing

Waikato River: Search resumes for person missing near Cambridge https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/waikato-river-search-resumes-for-person-missing-near-cambridge/7o3nk7dcivgnxbi3hs4j4udwgy/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/waikato-river-search-resumes-for-person-missing-near-cambridge/7o3nk7dcivgnxbi3hs4j4udwgy/ At this stage, it is unconfirmed how the person came to be in the river.
